conclusion: Determine path length of light within hemisphere and use speed to calculate time.
Triangle ABC is equilateral with side length L; hemisphere attached to base BC with center O; light enters at D on AB where BD = L/4.
Light enters hemisphere at D and travels to farthest point diametrically opposite on hemisphere's surface.
Radius R of hemisphere is half the side length of the triangle, R = L/2.
Longest path in the hemisphere is the diameter, which is 2R = L.
Speed of light in medium is v = c/n, where n is refractive index.
Time t for light to travel longest path L in medium is t = L/v.
Express time as t = nL/c if refractive index n is known.
